reviewText: Alternate retelling of Sentai Filmworks best ever anime, Clannad. Made by Toei Animation creators of Dragon Ball, Sailor Moon, and One piece. The TV series Clannad and Clannad After Story is made by Kyoto Animation creators of Kanon, Air TV, and The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya.95 Minutes on one dvd, Rated 13+ so just about anyone can enjoy this anime.Special Features: Clean Opening Animation, Clean Closing Animation, Production SketchesSpoken Languages: English, Japanese, English subtitles

Title: N/A

reviewText: Like Air the motion picture, created by Toei Animation, this is a nice retelling of the Clannad series, based off of the original Visual Novel by KEY/Visual Arts. Overall, this is a nice classic anime film about love and drama and is highly reccommended if you watched the tv series. My only complaint about this film is how tomoyo and kyou's personalities are different and kotomi only makes a brief appearance. Also, Fuko, Yukine, Ryou and Misae don't appear either which makes me sad because I like Yukine! If you haven't seen the TV series, this movie will probably be confusing, plus it doesn't have the same kind of emotional feelings you feel when watching the series. All in all, a great anime movie. Opening theme song is Mag Mell from the original visual novel and the ending credits play "Small Palms" and transitions into a song called "Marmell (I think)" and the upbeat happy, new "Dango Daikazoku!" A textless ending special feature will probably be pointless though since the credits play like Air the motion picture in which you get a black screen with occasional imagery framed in every 10 seconds or so. Haven't seen the english version yet, but it looks like it'll be great! Also look forward to Clannad After story with its new english dub and check out one of Sentai's newest releases, Koihime Musou.
summary: Clannad Theatrical comes to the US!
